frameDefinitions: An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
An Entity that is previously not visible to a Perceiver becomes visible.
An Entity is understood to be experienceable within a particular set of delimited Circumstances, which may be more narrowly expressed by a Time, Place.
A Captor ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a Theme from the Location_of_confinement.
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
frameExamples: MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
The armada <t>appeared</t> on the horizon at sunset.
This type of behavior <t>occurs</t> in several primate mating rituals.
They <t>released</t> me from prison on New Year's Day.
Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
listRoleDefinitions: The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
The thing that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is able to see or recognize.
A temporal description of the event of the <fen>Entity</fen> becoming visible.
The physical location in which the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes visible.
An object or event that is described as being available under delimited Conditions.
A temporal characterization of the circumstances of the existence of an <fen>Entity</fen>.
A spacial characterization of the <fex name=''>Circumstances</fex> of the existence of the <fex name=''>Entity</fex>.
A description of the state of the world in which the <fen>Entity</fen> can be experienced.
The <fen>Captor</fen> is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the <fen>Theme</fen>. The release of the <fen>Theme</fen> is in accord with the plans of the <fen>Captor</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the person or object in motion released by the <fen>Captor</fen>.
The location to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion was formerly inhibited.
The <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Captor</fen> release the <fen>Theme</fen> .
The location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ceases to be confined.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> released the suspect.
The police released <fex>the suspect</fex>.
She petitioned unsuccessfully for their release <fex>from Chateau D'If</fex>.
'Aren't you going to release us <fex>here</fex>?' she asked.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
<fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
